{ "id": 369, "title": "Raffolux player Karen makes headlines", "slug": "raffolux-player-karen-makes-headlines", "updated_on": "2023-04-26T12:29:51.829Z", "content": "Karen Hewit, a devoted mother from the UK, has been making headlines recently for her first holiday in 30 years. Karen has dedicated her entire life to caring for her son Jack, who has cerebral palsy and severe epilepsy. Her story of love and sacrifice has touched the hearts of people around the world, and it's been revealed that she's a long-term player of Raffolux.com, the online raffle site where she won her holiday.\r\n

\r\n\r\n

\r\nKaren's son, Jack, was diagnosed with cerebral palsy at birth, which affects movement and coordination, causing significant physical and developmental disabilities. In addition, Jack also has severe epilepsy, requiring around-the-clock care and attention. Karen has been his primary caregiver for the past 30 years, providing constant support and assistance.\r\n

\r\nRaffolux.com, the online raffle site, offers luxury prizes to raise money for charities, and Karen is a long-term player. Her participation in the site led her to win a week-long stay in a caravan park in Cornwall, a well-deserved break for her after three decades of caregiving.\r\n

\r\nThe trip was a life-changing experience for Karen, who could finally take a break from her caregiving duties and enjoy some time for herself. She could unwind and create beautiful memories, something that she has not had the chance to do for a long time.\r\n

\r\nKaren's story is a beautiful reminder of the importance of taking care of our loved ones, and the incredible sacrifices parents make for their children. Her dedication and selflessness serve as an inspiration to us all, and her well-deserved holiday is a testimony to the power of kindness and generosity.\r\n

\r\nWe are so happy that our lovely Karen enjoyed her trip away! Karen has appeared in many local papers such as Wales Online, Belfast Liveand over 16 other incredible titles. Don’t miss out… join the fun!\r\n

\r\n\r\n

\r\n ", "created_on": "2023-04-26T11:27:32.702Z", "status": 1, "author": "Raffolux", "img_alt": "Mum going on her first holiday in 30 years after dedicating life to looking after son", "img_url": "media/winners/KARENHDEVON.webp", "keywords": "x", "news_category": "ALL", "card_description": "Mum going on her first holiday in 30 years after dedicating", "meta_description": "Mum going on her first holiday in 30 years after dedicating life to looking after son", "meta_title": "Raffolux player Karen makes headlines" }

{ "id": 368, "title": "Using Raffles to Raise Money for Charity", "slug": "using-raffle-raise-money-charity", "updated_on": "2023-04-04T15:48:29.228Z", "content": "Raffles are a popular way to raise funds for charitable causes, and for good reason. They offer a fun and engaging way for people to contribute to a good cause while also having the chance to win a prize. Here are some of the benefits of using raffles to support charitable causes:\r\n

\r\nRaffles can raise significant funds : Raffles can be a highly effective way to raise funds for charities. By selling raffle tickets, charities can generate significant revenue that can be used to support their programs and initiatives.\r\n

\r\n Raffles help raise awareness : Raffles can be a great way to raise awareness about a particular cause or charity. By promoting the raffle through social media, email newsletters, and other channels, charities can reach a wider audience and educate them about the work they do.\r\n

\r\n Raffles engage supporters : Raffles can be a fun and engaging way to involve supporters in fundraising efforts. By offering attractive prizes and promoting the raffle through various channels, charities can encourage people to get involved and contribute to the cause.\r\n

\r\n Raffles build community : Raffles can help build a sense of community around a particular cause or charity. By bringing people together and encouraging them to support the same cause, charities can create a sense of shared purpose and inspire people to work together to achieve a common goal.\r\n

\r\n Raffles are flexible : Raffles can be tailored to suit the needs and goals of a particular charity. Charities can choose the type of prizes they want to offer, set the price of raffle tickets, and decide how many tickets to sell. This flexibility allows charities to create raffles that are tailored to their specific needs and goals.\r\n

\r\nIn conclusion, raffles can be a highly effective way for charities to raise funds, raise awareness, engage supporters, and build community. By using raffles to support their cause, charities can create a fun and engaging way for people to contribute to a good cause while also having the chance to win a prize. So, the next time you are looking for a way to support a charitable cause, consider buying a raffle ticket and giving back in a meaningful way.", "created_on": "2023-04-04T15:35:16.572Z", "status": 1, "author": "Raffolux", "img_alt": "Raising money for charities", "img_url": "media23/charityblog.webp", "keywords": "x", "news_category": "ALL", "card_description": "Find out about the benefits of using a raffle to raise money", "meta_description": "x", "meta_title": "x" }

With its stunning beaches, lush green hills, vibrant nightlife, and rich history, Corfu has something for everyone. Raffolux is now giving you the chance to win a week all-inclusive holiday for 2 for just £1.99! So, let's dive in and explore why a holiday in Corfu should be on your bucket list.\r\n

\r\nThe first thing that comes to mind when thinking about Corfu is its stunning beaches. There are beaches for every taste, whether you prefer secluded coves or long stretches of sand with water sports and beach bars. Agios Georgios Pagon, Paleokastritsa, and Agios Gordios are some of the most popular beaches on the island. With crystal-clear waters and stunning scenery, these beaches are perfect for relaxing and soaking up the sun.\r\n

\r\nCorfu's historic landmarks are also a must-see. The Old Town of Corfu, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is a maze of narrow streets, alleys, and squares, surrounded by ancient Venetian walls. Exploring the old town is like stepping back in time, with its stunning architecture, beautiful churches, and historic fortresses.\r\n

\r\nCorfu is also known for its delicious food and wine. The island has a rich culinary tradition, with plenty of fresh seafood, grilled meats, and local specialties like sofrito and pastitsada. You can also try local wines, such as the white Robola and the red Mavrodaphne, both of which are produced on the island.\r\n

\r\nThe island's natural beauty is also a big draw for visitors. The lush green hills, olive groves, and cypress trees create a stunning landscape that is perfect for hiking and exploring. The Corfu Trail is a 220 km hiking trail that takes you through the island's stunning countryside and along its beautiful coastline.\r\n

\r\nCorfu's nightlife is also famous, with plenty of bars, clubs, and beach parties to keep you entertained. Whether you prefer a sophisticated cocktail lounge or a wild party on the beach, you'll find something to suit your taste.\r\n

With its stunning beaches, lush green hills, vibrant nightlife, and rich history, Corfu has something for everyone. Raffolux is now giving you the chance to win a week all-inclusive holiday for 2 for just £1.99! So, let's dive in and explore why a holiday in Corfu should be on your bucket list.\r\n

\r\nThe first thing that comes to mind when thinking about Corfu is its stunning beaches. There are beaches for every taste, whether you prefer secluded coves or long stretches of sand with water sports and beach bars. Agios Georgios Pagon, Paleokastritsa, and Agios Gordios are some of the most popular beaches on the island. With crystal-clear waters and stunning scenery, these beaches are perfect for relaxing and soaking up the sun.\r\n

\r\nCorfu's historic landmarks are also a must-see. The Old Town of Corfu, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is a maze of narrow streets, alleys, and squares, surrounded by ancient Venetian walls. Exploring the old town is like stepping back in time, with its stunning architecture, beautiful churches, and historic fortresses.\r\n

\r\nCorfu is also known for its delicious food and wine. The island has a rich culinary tradition, with plenty of fresh seafood, grilled meats, and local specialties like sofrito and pastitsada. You can also try local wines, such as the white Robola and the red Mavrodaphne, both of which are produced on the island.\r\n

\r\nThe island's natural beauty is also a big draw for visitors. The lush green hills, olive groves, and cypress trees create a stunning landscape that is perfect for hiking and exploring. The Corfu Trail is a 220 km hiking trail that takes you through the island's stunning countryside and along its beautiful coastline.\r\n

\r\nCorfu's nightlife is also famous, with plenty of bars, clubs, and beach parties to keep you entertained. Whether you prefer a sophisticated cocktail lounge or a wild party on the beach, you'll find something to suit your taste.\r\n
